1.text: Now faith is the personal foundation of things hoped for, certainty about things that cannot be seen.

2.text: By this, people of old obtained approval.

3.text: By faith, we understand that the universe was formed by the word of God, so that what is visible was made from what is invisible.

4.text: By faith, Abel offered to God a sacrifice more excellent than Cain’s, and through this a testimony was given to him that he was righteous. God testified about his gifts, and although Abel is now dead, he still speaks.

5.text: By faith, Enoch was taken away in order not to see death: he was not found because God had translated him. He too had received a testimony that before his translation, he had been well-pleasing to God.

6.text: Without faith it is impossible to please God, for whoever comes to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.

7.text: By faith, Noah, being warned about things not yet seen, was moved with godly fear. He prepared a ship to save his household and by this means he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.

8.text: By faith, Abraham, when he was called, obeyed and left the place which he was supposed to receive as his inheritance. He left, not knowing where he was going.

9.text: By faith, he lived as an alien in the land of the promise, as in a land that was not his own, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob who were heirs with him of the same promise.

10.text: Indeed, Abraham looked for the city which has foundations and whose architect and builder is God.

11.text: By faith, even Sarah received power to conceive and she bore a child when she was past the age because she considered that the one who had promised was faithful.

12.text: Therefore, one man became the father to [people] as numerous as the stars of the sky and as innumerable as the sand on the sea shore, even though he was as good as dead.

13.text: These people all died in faith, [yet] not having received the promises. They had seen and embraced them from afar, and they confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims upon the earth.

14.text: Certainly, people who say such things make it clear that they are seeking a country of their own.

15.text: If they had been thinking of the country they had originally left, they would have had enough time to return.

16.text: But in fact, they desire a better country, a heavenly one. Therefore, God is not ashamed of them, or ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

17.text: By faith, Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac [in sacrifice]. Yes, he who had joyfully received the promises was now offering up his uniquely loved son,

18.text: the very one of whom it was said, “In Isaac will your seed be called.”

19.text: Abraham concluded that God was even able to raise up the dead and figuratively speaking, he did receive Isaac back from the dead.

20.text: By faith, Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even regarding future events.

21.text: By faith, Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each one of Joseph’s sons and bowed down, leaning on the top of his staff.

22.text: By faith, Joseph, when his end was near, made mention of the exodus of the children of Israel and gave instructions concerning his bones.

23.text: By faith, Moses, when he was born, was hidden for three months by his parents because they saw that he was a beautiful child and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.

24.text: By faith, Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,

25.text: choosing to share ill-treatment with God’s people rather than enjoy the pleasures of sin for a time.

26.text: He considered the disgrace of the Anointed greater wealth than the treasures of Egypt because he had his eyes fixed on the reward.

27.text: By faith, he left Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king, but he persevered as if seeing him who is invisible.

28.text: By faith, Moses kept the Passover and the sprinkling of the blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them.

29.text: By faith, they passed through the Red Sea as on land and when the Egyptians tried to do likewise, they were swallowed up.

30.text: By faith, the walls of Jericho fell down, after the people [of the city] had been encircled for seven days.

31.text: By faith, Rahab the prostitute did not perish with those who were disobedient because she had received the spies in peace.

32.text: What more shall I say? Time would fail me if I mentioned Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets.

33.text: Through faith, they overpowered kingdoms, administered justice, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

34.text: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, became strong in weakness, grew mighty in war and caused foreign armies to flee.

35.text: Women received their dead by resurrection. Others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.

36.text: Others were tried by mocking and scourging, yes, by chains and imprisonment.

37.text: They were stoned, they were sawn apart, they were tempted and they were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep and goat skins, being destitute, afflicted, and ill-treated. And yet the world was not worthy of them!

38.text: They wandered in deserts, mountains, caves, and the holes of the earth.

39.text: All of them received a testimony through their faith but they did not receive the promise

40.text: because God had made provision for us to have something better, and they were not to reach perfection apart from us.
